lead_paragraph: Argentina lost its unbeaten record in World Cup qualifiers last night as Colombia took advantage of a first-half red card on Argentina’s Carlos Tevez to win their match by 2-1. Giancarlo Maldonado scored twice to lift host Venezuela to a 5-3 victory over Bolivia in another qualifying match. Argentina is in first place in the South American group with 9 points after four games. Colombia is second with 8.
